summary: This document consists of email exchanges between FBI agents in July-August 2020 regarding a volunteer opportunity to assist with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The emails discuss the need for help with evidence preparation, organization, and review for discovery.

persons.name: SA M
persons.context: Appears to be the primary contact in the New York Field Office for the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad, coordinating volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents working on or coordinating assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, with SA being cc'd on correspondence to SA M.

events.title: Volunteer request for investigation assistance
events.description: An FBI agent expresses interest in volunteering to assist with the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically with evidence preparation and review.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The assistance needed included preparing and organizing evidence for discovery, reviewing items, and listening to recordings.
The investigation was described as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' within the FBI.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein/Maxwell well after Epstein's death in 2019.
